Reasoning: **My Analysis of the Planet Pack Selection**

Okay, here's the situation: I'm staring at the Celestial Pack selection screen. It's Round 9, with an ante of 4/8, and I've got $38 in the bank. Let's see, my Joker lineup is looking pretty solid: Green Joker (Holo), Mystic Summit, Spare Trousers, Certificate, Luchador (the boss-buster), and that pesky Constellation.

Now, my hand levels are: Full House Level 4 (good base chips and mult), Pair Level 4 (solid fallback), Three of a Kind Level 4, and some lower levels for other hands. I'm focusing on consistent, high-scoring hands.

I have three planets to choose from: Pluto (High Card, not really my style), Mercury (Pair, leveling up a hand I already play, Level 4 to 5), and Mars (Four of a Kind, a big jump, Level 1 to 2, but harder to hit).

The crucial point: any planet selection will trigger Constellation, which will increase my Multiplier. Constellation is currently at x2.0 but will go up to x2.1 with any planet selected.

My goal is to pick the planet that gives me the most utility, or strengthens a hand I can *actually* play. Mercury, leveling a Pair, is a *reliable* option because Pairs are easy to come by, even as part of other hands (though only the scoring hand counts).

Mars gives a much bigger boost, leveling a Four of a Kind, but is tougher to pull off, even with Certificate adding some extra cards. Pluto is just not good.

Considering past hand history, Three of a Kind, Full House, and Flushes have been my bread and butter. Spare Trousers rewards Two Pair. Two Pair contains a Pair, and is fairly easy to get.

While leveling up a Pair is consistent, and is level 4, Mercury would get me to Level 5. Strengthening a hand I actually *play* is the priority. Actually, strengthening Pair is a good option since it's easy to pivot to.

Mercury is the best choice here. Leveling up Pair offers the most consistent value, while allowing me to pivot to Two Pair. Leveling Four of a Kind is a better scaling value, but is harder to trigger.

**Action: Select Mercury**

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

**My Analysis and Decision-Making Process**

Okay, here we are in the shop phase. I have $34, and the goal is to reach Ante 8. I'm currently on Ante 4, Round 9. I need to make the best use of my resources.

I have a decent Joker setup: Green Joker (Holo), Mystic Summit, Spare Trousers, a Certificate, Luchador, and Constellation. My hand levels are solid, with Pair at 5, Full House at 4, and Three of a Kind at 4. The main focus is on a no-discard, high-hand play style to scale with Mystic Summit and Spare Trousers, and to increase hands played.

I'm presented with a Tarot Pack, and the choices are The Sun (Hearts), The Devil (Gold Card), and The World (Spades). The Sun and The World are tempting if I wanted to force a flush build. But I'm not focusing on that right now; a Two Pair/Three of a Kind/Full House strategy is more reliable.

The Devil looks like the best play for my current build. Creating a Gold Card for $3 end-of-round income is a solid economy move, especially since I'm running a "no discard" setup, which means I'll keep the cards around. I already have one Gold Card, and with no plans to flush, diamonds are not important.

I have a Gold Card (8 of Diamonds, position 6). I need to make a card into a gold card. I don't want to use it on a high card I want to play, so I need to put it on a card I'm likely to hold. The 2 of Diamonds (position 8) is a good candidate, as it's unlikely to feature in a high-scoring hand. Making it Gold will provide $3 at the end of the round.

The choice is clear: I need to use the Devil to enhance a card. I want to choose the Devil (2) and target the 2 of Diamonds (8) so I will be able to hold the Gold Card. I'll make sure to verify the correct format and data structure.
